attachments.title: Unexamined Privilege is the real source of cruelty in Facebook’s “Your Year in Review”
attachments.text: UNEXAMINED PRIVILEGE is the real source of cruelty in Facebook’s “Your Year in Review”—a feature conceived and designed by a group to whom nothing terrible has happened yet. A brilliant upper-middl...
attachments.fallback: Jeffrey Zeldman Presents The Daily Report: Web Design News & Insights Since 1995: Unexamined Privilege is the real source of cruelty in Facebook’s “Your Year in Review”

text: <@U02618EV1> good story! Facebook isn't the only company with this problem. LinkedIn is so aggressive about collecting emails that it keeps suggesting I should connect with a friend who died 2 years ago.

Oh, that's horrible. I think there's so much to learn from the FB's LinkedIn's of the world. They have obscene amounts of money and talent but they manage miss some of these basic human/emotional aspects in their "social" products.
I wouldn't say they're missing it. :wink:
